article_text:
Christopher Updike has joined law firm Debevoise & Plimpton and will be counsel in the firm’s business restructuring and workouts practice. Mr. Updike, who will work out of the New York office, represents debtors, creditors, lenders in others in chapter 11 bankruptcy and workouts outside of court. He also has represented clients in industries including airlines, gaming, health care and mining. Most recently, Mr. Updike was special counsel at Cadwalader, Wickersham & Taft. He is a member of the American Bankruptcy Institute.

John Ventola has been named co-chair of the finance and restructuring group at law firm Choate, Hall & Stewart. He focuses on bankruptcy, restructuring, finance and private equity. With current co-chair Doug Gooding, Mr. Ventola will help lead the group in representing financial institutions, debt funds borrowers and others. He earned his law degree from Boston College Law School.

Peter G. Wollmeringer has joined Huron Consulting Group as a managing director in the business advisory practice, where he will work out of the New York office. Mr. Wollmeringer, who most recently was a senior director at turnaround advisory firm Alvarez & Marsal, has worked with clients in industries including technology, private equity and telecommunications. He is a member of the American Bankruptcy Institute.

Compiled by Melanie Cohen
